brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts a DHCP client obtaining its IP configuration from a DHCP server.

Initially, the client broadcasts a DHCP DISCOVER packet to identify any available DHCP servers. A DHCP server replies with a DHCP OFFER, which is a lease offer message with an assigned IP address, subnet mask, DNS server, default gateway, and lease duration.

The client then broadcasts a DHCP REQUEST packet that identifies the server and lease offer that the client is accepting. Lastly, the server returns a DHCP ACK message that acknowledges to the client that the lease is finalized.
